newsitem.title: UK: S&P may cut ratings on Compagnie Bancaire.
newsitem.headline: S&P may cut ratings on Compagnie Bancaire.

text.p: Standard & Poor's said on Wednesday it had placed its A long-term and A1 short-term ratings of Compagnie Bancaire and its affiliates on CreditWatch with negative implications.
At the same time, S&P said it affirmed its A minus long-term and A2 short-term ratings of Compagnie Financiere de Paribas (CFP), Banque Paribas and its subsidiaries.
CFP owns 46.6 percent of Compagnie Bancaire.

"This decision follows Compagnie Bancaire's announcement of a forecast 1.2 billion French franc loss, (excluding minority interest) for the whole year 1996, which reflects the group's decision to post a 2.5 billion franc provision to cover its property finance and property development activities," S&P said in a statement.

It said that coinciding with this announcement Compagnie Bancaire sold six percent of its consumer finance subsidiary Cetelem CETF.PA, generating approximately a one billion franc capital gain that will help offset the provision charge.

"Standard & Poor's will meet Compagnie Bancaire's management in weeks ahead to examine the impact of the measures announced on the group's overall financial profile, the adequacy of the provisioning on its residual real estate commitments and the capacity of Compagnie Bancaire to return to profits," the statement said.
